tweet.text: Thinking we're only one signature away from ending the war in Iraq. Learn more at http://www.barackobama.com
Wondering why, four years after President Bush landed on an aircraft carrier and declared ‘Mission Accomplished,’ we are still at war?
At the Detroit Economic Club – Talking about the need to reduce our dependence on foreign oil.
Thinking we can cut oil consumption by 2.5 million barrels of oil per day and take 50 million cars’ worth of pollution off the road by 2020
In Indianola, Iowa and heading to Des Moines
In Trenton, NJ at AFL-CIO Town Hall Meeting
Thinking the President’s word is not the last word on Iraq.
Speaking at Southern New Hampshire University Commencement
In DC voting No... "We should not give the President a blank check to continue down this same, disastrous path.”
At the University of Iowa envisioning affordable universal healthcare by end of first term.
Looking forward to watching Michelle's interview on NBC nightly news tonight.
Heading to Democratic presidential debate at St. Anselm College in New Hampshire. Debate starts at 7pm EST and will air live on CNN.
Preparing for our big "Walk for Change" national canvass - Heading to Dubuque, Iowa for tomorrow's walk.
Being featured on YouTube "Candidate Spotlight" asking how can we make this country better?
Traveling to Jackson, Mississippi - excited after rallying with over 3500 supporters in Greenville, South Carolina.
Launching Obama Mobile text messaging; text 'GO' to OBAMA (62262) to get a free bumper sticker.
In DC: Asking you to share what inspires you on the front page of www.barackobama.com

Heading to Alabama for the Birmingham kick-off rally.

Enjoying an ice cream social with residents of Sunapee, New Hampshire.
Addressing the College Democrats of America at their national convention in Columbia, SC.
In Chicago - heading to the AFL-CIO Presidential Forum. It is on MSNBC tonight live at 7pm EDT, moderated by Keith Olbermann.

In Tama, IA for a Rural Policy Summit @ South Tama County High School. Heading to Cedar Rapids and Waverly tomorrow.
In New York - heading to The Daily Show with Jon Stewart. Be sure to watch it on Comedy Central tonight.
Thinking on this 2nd anniversary of Katrina that New Orleans should become an example of what America can do when we come together.
Speaking at town halls in Sac City and Storm Lake, Iowa today. Heading to Nevada tomorrow.
Giving a major Iraq policy speech tomorrow in Iowa and will also be live on the Today Show tomorrow morning at 7:00am.

"America prevailed because we chose to move forward as one nation. Again, we are tested. And again we must answer history’s call." #SOTU
"It is because of the spirit and resilience of Americans that I have never been more hopeful about America’s future than I am tonight" #SOTU
"The bank bailout was about as popular as a root canal. But I promised I wouldn’t just do what was popular—I would do what was necessary."
"Because of the Recovery Act, there are about two million Americans working right now who would otherwise be unemployed." #SOTU
"People are out of work. They are hurting. They need our help. And I want a jobs bill on my desk without delay." #SOTU
"We can’t allow financial institutions, including those that take your deposits, to take risks that threaten the whole economy." #SOTU
"The nation that leads the clean energy economy will be the nation that leads the global economy. And America must be that nation." #SOTU
"In the 21st century, one of the best anti-poverty programs is a world-class education." #SOTU
"I will not walk away from the millions of Americans who need health care, and neither should the people in this chamber." #SOTU
"All of our men and women in uniform around the world must know that they have our respect, our gratitude, and our full support." #SOTU
"I never said change would be easy. When you try to do big things & make big changes it stirs passions & controversy—that’s just how it is."
"We don’t quit. I don’t quit. Let’s seize this moment—to start anew, to carry the dream forward, and to strengthen our union once more."
